content.description:
In the cave around the southwest corner of the Skull Crusher Boulder, there is this great, little, roof crack problem. Sit start on a slopey rail, make a large reach to a decent, slopey edge to the left, and then get situated in the roof crack. From here, the route eases with good holds to a mantel at the lip on finger locks.

This also has a stand that starts at the lowest roof jugs and goes in the V3 range.

If any info is known about name or FA, please let me know. I am just adding it here, because this is a fun line.
content.protection: A few pads are nice to have for the top out
content.location: Southwest corner of the skull crusher boulder in the cave. Sit start.

content.description: Start standing matched on the good hold on the left side of the face. Work right and up into the main ledge feature and reach for a high, right sidepull. Go to the center of the lip to finish. There's a pretty good hold, but beware of ripping off if you swing. This line avoids the arÃªte and the choss block and takes advantage of the great holds that climb in from the left. With good temps, the crux can be a long static move off the sidepull.
content.protection: A few pads for the solo climber. A spotter is recommended.

content.description:
Start at the lowest big hold on the north east arete. Climb straight up. Be careful of the cracked block at the top. It looks like it may be coming off soon, hopefully without anyone under it.

There is a low start on the left side of the east face of the boulder on a large start hold, it goes up a few moves then traverses right to the stand. It probably goes around V6.
content.location: From the Highball Boulder, hike south over a hill. You will see it slightly to the southwest from the top of the hill.

climbs.name: Pod Tooth
climbs.fa: Nathan Hansen, as far as we know

content.description: Start on the two lowest, square-ish crimps that are part of the crack. Bump or cross your way up the holds of the crack into the uncomfortable- looking pod higher up that looks like it's got a tooth sticking up in the middle. Top out straight up.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter is smart.
content.location: On the north face of skull crusher, this ascends the thin crack going up and left on the right side of the face.
This is on the East face of Skull Crusher Boulder with a good starting ledge on the lower left.

content.description: This line starts at the first low jug of superior nuchal line. Start with your feet plastered out left, and work your way out the roof crack to reach this lip at which finger locks, a mantel, and even some heel hooks can be used to top out via the crack system. This is a fun easier stand/squat start to the harder sit.
content.location: This is on the southwest side of the boulder in the cave around the left side of the boulder from Skull Crusher proper.

content.description:
Start on a chest-high crimp. From here, work up and right to the obvious tooth. The crux involves getting into compression on the block and getting the feet up over the original overhang. Delicate climbing remains to reach the top.

If any FA info or name is known, please contact me. There is chalk on the route.
content.location: It ascends the southeast corner just left of the arete used for Friction.
